listCustomFeats.name: (Over)-Zealous Assault
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You take damage that would reduce you to 0 Hit Points.

You don't go down without a fight, make a Strike against the target before it gets to act.
If the target is the subject of your zealous derision, you gain a +2
circumstance bonus to the attack roll

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Inquisitor Techniques
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Archetype Inquisitor
Prerequisites Basic Inquisitor Techniques

You gain one inquisitor feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your inquisitor level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another inquisitor feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Antagonize
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your taunts and threats earn your foes ire. When you successfully Demoralize a creature, its Frightened condition can't decrease to less than 1 at the end of its turn until it either uses a hostile action against you or can no longer observe or sense you for at least 1 round.

listCustomFeats.name: Awaken Discontent
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You need to roll a Will saving throw

Prerequisites conversion ideal

You steel your mind against something that wants to influence your state of mind.

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Will saves for the triggering
check

listCustomFeats.name: Back to Back
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
When flanking you and your flanking partner both gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC.
Because you communicate with hand signals to make this bonus happen, this action gains the visual trait.


Special You designate your flanking partner during your daily preparation

listCustomFeats.name: Basic Inquisitor Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the Basic Bounded Spellcasting Feat benefits

listCustomFeats.name: Basic Inquisitor Techniques
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Archetype Inquisitor
Prerequisites Inquisitor dedication

You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level inquisitor feat of your choice

listCustomFeats.name: Burn Shroud
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You burn away a creature's disguise. You gain the Burn Shroud focus spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1

listCustomFeats.name: Cantrip Expansion
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
A greater understanding of your magic broadens your
range of simple spells

Add two additional cantrips from your spell list to your repertoire.

listCustomFeats.name: Communal Judgement
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You've mastered the art of sharing your defining spells. When you use a focus spell with the judgement trait, select one ally who qualifies who also gains the effect of the spell, as well as the effect of your  Divine Smite class feature. The shared spell can be sustained by either you or the ally you share the spell with. If neither of you sustains the effect, the spell fades at the end of the round.

listCustomFeats.name: Confess your Sins
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger you roll a critical on an attack roll or the target rolls a critical failure on a save against a judgement spell.

You do not roll for damage on the additional effect, you instead gain the maximum value of the die. This only includes the extra effect, like baleful bane's persistent damage or fear the flame's fire damage. Not the total damage dealt.

listCustomFeats.name: Confietor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You unleash a devastating blast of energy as you cast down the sword of confession.

You gain the Confiteor judgement spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Deny Support
listCustomFeats.textDescription: When you succeed or critically succeed at a Deception check to Feint an opponent, that target can't flank with their allies until the beginning of your next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Devastating Gaze
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You fill your target with fear with even the slightest transgression.

You can use Stern Gaze against an enemy who fails at an attack roll against an ally provided you have both damaged that creature on your last turn with a Strike or spell and it currently suffers from the persistent damage of Baleful Bane.

listCustomFeats.name: Discussed Extra Attack
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action.

Whenever you critically hit an Off-Guard opponent with a Strike or spell that has the attack trait the target triggers a Reactive Strike reaction from one ally of your choice who qualifies for teamwork, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.

listCustomFeats.name: Domain Disciple
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Through your conviction, you have glimpsed the deeper secrets of your deity's domain. You gain an advanced domain spell from the domain you chose with Domain Initiate.

You can cast that spell as a judgement spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Domain Initiate
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers. Select one domain—a subject of particular interest to you within your religion—from your deity's list. You gain an initial domain spell for that domain, a spell unique to the domain and not available to other clerics.

Domain spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to pray to your deity or do service toward their causes.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and can't be cast using spell slots. Your focus pool can hold one Focus Point for each focus spell you have, up to 3 points.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different domain each time and gaining its domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Dread Striker
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses. Any creature that has the Frightened condition is also Off-Guard against your attacks.

listCustomFeats.name: Expert Inquisitor Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Basic Inquisitor Spellcasting; master in Religion

You gain the Expert Bounded Spellcasting Feat benefits

listCustomFeats.name: Gaze of the Inquisitor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites inquisitor dedication

You gain the Inquisitor's Stern Gaze reaction

listCustomFeats.name: Grand Ideal Benefits:Conversion
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites: conversion ideal

You can deliver a stirring speech condemning the mistakes of those in power while calling for reform or change.

You gain the Swaying words focus spell. A spell which has the possibility of confusing your enemies.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Grand Ideal Benefits:Damnation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites damnation ideal

You instill the fear of a soul stealing monstrosity unto a living creature, making it think something is here to drag its soul away to oblivion and eternal damnation.

You gain the Collector of Souls focus spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1

listCustomFeats.name: Grand Ideal Benefits:Heresy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You cast a forbidden curse against a single creature, which conveys everything it despises, or its deity prohibits, affecting it dearly.

You gain the Word of Anathema focus spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Grand Ideal Benefits:Zeal
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You tap into your Inner Strength, a reservoir of unmatched zeal and conviction.

You gain the inner strength focus spell, which allows you to overcome certain conditions and gives you a new lease on life.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Idealistic Guidance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You receive the Idealistic Guidance Reaction

Trigger One of the required allies is about to attempt an attack roll or skill check.

Frequency Once per hour

You quickly advise your ally, using your earlier planning to make sure luck can't throw a wrench in the cogs of your schemes.

The ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the roll if you are within 30 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Impossible Gaze
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your gaze can be felt from a large distance.

You can use Stern Gaze even when creatures Critically Fail a ranged weapon or spell attack or if you Critically Succeed on a saving throw against an enemy's spell as long as you are within 30 feet of the creature.

listCustomFeats.name: Inquisitive Barrister
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You swiftly assess your target.


As part of the Cast a Spell action for baleful bane, you can attempt a check to Recall Knowledge about a creature.

When you critically succeed at identifying your target with Recall
Knowledge, you note a weakness in the creature’s defenses. You and allies you tell gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll against that target.


You can give bonuses from Inquisitive Barrister only once per day against a particular creature. You can use this feat again once you down the creature you used this on.

listCustomFeats.name: Inquisitive Magistrate
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Inquisitive Persecutor; master in Religion

You have a nearly encyclopedic knowledge of all creatures of the world and beyond.
You can use Religion to Recall Knowledge to identify any creature.

In addition, you gain the benfits of Inquisitive Barrister (and Inquisitive Persecutor, if you have it) on a success as well as a critical success

listCustomFeats.name: Inquisitive Persecutor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirement: Inquisitive Barrister

You understand how to defend yourself and others against your target. When you grant bonuses from Inquisitive Barrister, you and your allies also each gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next saving throw against that particular creature and to your AC against that creature’s next attack against you.

listCustomFeats.name: Inquisitor Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You gain the Cast a Spell activity.

You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for divine spells. Your key spellcasting ability for inquisitor archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are divine inquisitor spells.
You gain a spell repertoire and two cantrips. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the inquisitor archetype, add a spell of that level or lower to your repertoire. Each time you lose spell slots of a particular level, remove those spells from your repertoire.


Choose a deity as you would if you were an inquisitor. You become bound by that deity's anathema. You become trained in Religion, if you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your
choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of deity.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the inquisitor archetype

listCustomFeats.name: Inquisitve Judge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your knowledge of outsiders is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your targets.

Your bonus from Inquisitive Barrister (and the bonus from Inquisitive Persecutor if you have it) increases from +1 to +2 for you and any allies who benefit.

listCustomFeats.name: Inqusitor's Inquisition
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You set out on your inquisition. You gain the benefits of the Initial Inquisition class feature

listCustomFeats.name: Judgement
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Inquisitor dedication

You gain the Baleful Bane judgement spell.

If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point

listCustomFeats.name: Judgement Focus
listCustomFeats.textDescription: If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Judgement Wellspring
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You fill your target with fear with even the slightest transgression.

You can use Stern Gaze against an enemy who fails at an attack roll against you (not just critically fails) provided you have both damaged that creature on your last turn with a Strike or spell and it currently suffers from the persistent damage of Baleful Bane.

listCustomFeats.name: Luminous Flare
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You create a radiant aura that çghts of the darkness and reveals invisible creatures. You gain the Luminous Flare spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Magic Sense
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-rank detect magic spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you Seek, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-rank Detect Magic spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.

Special This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, primal, or occult).

listCustomFeats.name: Mend The Broken
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You learn how to use positive energy to heal a wound and provide temporary regeneration.

You gain the Mend The Broken focus spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Minor Ideal Benefits
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Select an ideal, you gain the minor ideal benefits. You don't gain any of the ideal's other benefits

listCustomFeats.name: Nimble Dodge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

Requirements You are not encumbered.

You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

listCustomFeats.name: Pre-Arranged Distraction
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet is about to Strike an enemy that is also within 30 feet.

With a sharp whistle or wave of your hands, you distract an opponent from the fact that one of your allies is about to attack them.

The target is Off-Guard against all the Strikes the ally makes on their next turn; the ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the first attack roll on their turn.

If your ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost. Depending on how you describe your distraction, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

Special the affected enemy is now immune to Pre-Arranged Distraction for 1 minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Draw
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You Interact to draw a weapon, then Strike with that weapon.

listCustomFeats.name: Running Reload
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can reload your weapon on the move. You Stride, Step, or Sneak, then Interact to reload

listCustomFeats.name: Sense The Unseen
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You fail a check to Seek.

When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues, such as their minute movements or the shifting of air currents on your skin. Even though you failed at the triggering check, you automatically sense any undetected creatures in the area where you're Seeking, making them merely Hidden to you.

listCustomFeats.name: Snap Shot
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters. You can use a reaction that normally allows you to make a melee weapon Strike to instead make a ranged weapon Strike. You must be Striking an adjacent target. If necessary for the reaction's trigger, you treat your ranged weapon as if it had a reach of 5 feet. If the reaction has other requirements, such as wielding a specific kind of weapon, Snap Shot doesn't allow you to ignore them; it allows you only to replace a melee weapon Strike with a ranged weapon Strike.

listCustomFeats.name: Stare of Damnation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You use Stern Gaze
Prerequisites: damnation ideal

You imbue the feeling of damnation with your gaze.

Instead of using Stern Gaze, you use a way more insidious version.

Instead of Frightening the target, you Stupefied 1 it instead. This stupified effect last for 3 rounds

listCustomFeats.name: Stare of Ill Omen
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You use Stern Gaze
Prerequisites heresy ideal

You imbue your gaze with a terrible grudge.

Instead of using Stern Gaze, you use a way more insidious version.

Instead of Frightened the creature becomes Sickened 1 instead.

This sickened effect last for 3 rounds

listCustomFeats.name: Steady Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Confident in your technique, you don't lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC 15 Flat Check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

listCustomFeats.name: Suffer not the Mage
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses the Cast a Spell action

Make a Strike against the triggering creature.

This Strike doesn’t count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn’t apply to this Strike.
If you successfully hit the creature, it has to make a DC 0 Fortitude] Fortitude save against your spell DC, on a failure you disrupt the spell.

The triggering creature does not loose the spell slot on a failure, as the casting is interrupted before expending the spell slot.

listCustomFeats.name: Supreme Judgement
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You've made it almost effortless to combine spells and attacks.
You're permanently quickened.
You can use your extra action only to Strike or to cast or sustain a spell with the judgement trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Sustained Reload
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You've mastered doing two things at once. You sustain a spell with the judgement trait, then Interact to reload.

listCustomFeats.name: Swift Tracker
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you're moving. You can move at your full Speed while you Track. If you have master proficiency in Survival, you don't need to attempt a new Survival check every hour while Tracking. If you have legendary proficiency in Survival, you can use another exploration activity while Tracking.

If you roll Survival for initiative while tracking your hunted prey, when you start your first turn of the encounter, you can Stride toward your hunted prey as a free action.

listCustomFeats.name: That's Odd
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
When you enter a new location, such as a room or corridor, you immediately notice one thing out of the ordinary. The GM determines what it is, or whether there's nothing reasonable to pick up, skipping obvious clues that can be easily noticed without a check or specifically looking for them. You learn only that an area or object is suspicious, but not why it's suspicious.

For example, if you entered a study with a large bloodstain on the ground, the bloodstain is so obviously suspicious it's evident to you already, so the GM might note that there's something suspicious about the desk drawer instead. You would then need to investigate the drawer further to find out what specifically is out of the ordinary. That's Odd doesn't reveal whether creatures are suspicious.

You don't typically get any benefit when you leave and come back to a place, though if a major change has happened there and time has passed, the GM might determine that you do.

listCustomFeats.name: Vexing Bolt
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You shoot a bolt of divine energy towards a target. You gain the

Vexing Bolt judgement spell. A peculiar dart of magical energy that does never misses it's mark.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: We're a Team, Right?
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger Your turn ends.
Requirements One of your allies is currently affected by a mental effect that they gained by failing but not critically failing a saving throw

You shout encouraging words to your ally to break the mental effect.

The ally can immediatly reattempt another save against the effect. On a Failure the effect is surpressed until the end of your allies turn, but they make the next attempt at a -2 circumstance penalty.

On a Critical Failure nothing happens and the next check is also
made at a -2 circumstance penalty.

You can use We're A Team, Right? only once per mental effect.

Special You can use this reaction even if the mental effect is preventing you or your allies from using reactions

listCustomFeats.name: Wrathful Gaze
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Stern Gaze

You can gaze almost without a thought. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to perform a Stern Gaze

listCustomFeats.name: You're Next
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You reduce an enemy to 0 Hit Points.

After downing a foe, you menace another. Attempt to Demoralize a creature within 60 feet, with a +2 circumstance bonus. If you have legendary proficiency in Intimidation, you can use this as a free action with the same trigger.

listCustomSpells.name: Anchor of Life
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Area 20 foot burst
Targets a square you can see
Duration 1 minute

Range 30 feet Area 20-Foot Burst Targets A place you can see

Duration 1 minute

You create an anchor point close to you that exudes a 20-feet healing aura around it.
While within this aura you may roll any Recovery check twice and use the higher result.

While you or your allies are within the aura, all healing magic received is increased by 2d4

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 1d4

listCustomSpells.name: Baleful Bane
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range touch
Targets 1 creature

You gain divine insight for an improved understanding of wounding your target,

Strike with your weapon, you deal 1d4 additional damage as you smite your target.

Make a choice between vitality or void energy, when critically striking a target with your smite, you deal 1d6 persistent void or 1d6 persistent vitality damage.

Heightened (+2) Increase the precision damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage by 1d6

listCustomSpells.name: Banner of the profane Oath
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You create a magical banner that exudes a 30 feet aura.

While within the aura, you or your allies critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die, as long as that result is a success.

You or your allies can pick this banner up, or set it down using a single action. The banner can be destroyed, ending the spell.
The banner has 50 Hit Points and Hardness 15.

listCustomSpells.name: Burn Shroud
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range touch
Targets 1 creature
Saving Throw Fortitude

You touch a creature and burn his transformative magic right of its skin.

The target must attempt a Fortitude save.
If a creature is currently affected with an effect with the Polymorph trait, it has a -2 circumstance penalty to the save.

Critical Success the target is unaffected.
Success the target takes 2d12 fire damage. You can try to counteract the polymorph and transmutation effects.
Failure the target takes 4d12 fire damage and 5d4 persistent fire damage. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the counteract attempt.

Effect: Burn Shroud (Failure)
Critical Failure As failure, but the persistent fire damage increases to 10d4 persistent fire and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to counteract.

Heightened (+1) the fire damage increases by 1d12 fire and the the persistent fire damage increases by 1d4 on a failure.

listCustomSpells.name: Chains of Justice
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature
Duration 1 minute
Saving Throw Will

You bind an opponent to you with spectral chains. When you take damage from an enemy, reduce this
damage by half your level + your spellcasting modifer 0 , your bound target instead takes the damage you prevented.
If you take damage that is less than what you can reduce, it takes the full damage instead.

The target can not move more than 30 feet away from you. But if you ever move out of range,
the spell immediately ends. The target can repeat it's saving throw each time it is attacked from outside of the spell range

listCustomSpells.name: Collector of Souls
listCustomSpells.traits: Emotion, Fear, Illusion, Inquisitor, Judgement, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature
Saving Throw Will

You create a phantasmal image of a monstrosity that will try to steal the soul of a target and drag it unto
oblivion.

Only the spell's target can see the monstrosity. The effect of the spell is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target takes 4d6 mental damage and is Frightened 1.
Failure The target takes 8d6 mental l damage and is Frightened 2.
Critical Failure The target takes 16d6 mental l damage is Frightened 4 and is Fleeing until the end of its next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

listCustomSpells.name: Confiteor
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 60 feet
Area 30-foot Burst
Saving Throw Reflex

Requirements The target is suffering from the persistent damage of baleful bane or are you are sustaining divine might.

You unleash a devastating explosion of divine energy.


You call forth the sword of confession that smites the area and deals 12d6 slashing damage to any creature in the 10-Foot Burst at the center of its area of effect before exploding dealing your choice of 6d12 vitality or 6d12 void to any creature in its 30-Foot Burst
The saving throw applies to both the slashing and the energy damage.

listCustomSpells.name: Crest of Faith
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Trigger a creature deals Vitality or Void damage to you

The word and scriptures of your deity and your ideal become written in the air around you, and form a protective shield for the blink of a moment.
The shield has Hardness 15 and 30 Hit Points and remains until the start of your next turn. If the shield breaks you make a Religioncheck, against the triggering creaure's Will DC.
On a failure you gain regeneration 3 for 1 minute, on a success all allies within 30 feet also get
this effect

Heightened (+1) the shield gains 5 Hardness. The regeneration increases by 1

listCustomSpells.name: Divine Prison
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 3 creatures
Duration varies

You cage a creature in divine light, making it unable to act.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is Stunned 1

Failure The target is Stunned 2
Critical Failure The target is Paralyze for 2 rounds.

Heightened (+2) You can target 1 additional creature

listCustomSpells.name: Excommunicate
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range touch
Targets 1 creature
Duration sustained for up to 1 minute

You hammer a creature's senses to make it feel alone and deslote.

You place a curse on it that simultaneously tries to blind, silence, deafen and bind it.

The creature is automatically affected. Each time you sustain the spell the creature makes a Fortitude saving throw, if you don't sustain the spell the effect ends at the end of your round.


Critical Success The spell ends immediately.
Success The target is Dazzled, and Deafened.
Failure The target is Blinded, Deafened, Clumsy 1 and
Stupefied 1.
Critical Failure As failure, but Clumsy 2, Stupefied 2 and Restrained

listCustomSpells.name: Fear The Flames
listCustomSpells.traits: Auditory, Emotion, Focus, Inquisitor, Judgement, Linguistic, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Duration sustained for up to 1 minute
Saving Throw Will

You frighten a creature with an eternity of suãering. Choose a creature within range who you're aware of,
the target needs to make a Will saving throw. If the target does not understand the language you are
speaking, or you're not speaking a language, it has a +4 circumstance bonus to the save. The first time each
turn, when you Sustain the spell, you can target another creature you can see within range

Critical Success The target is unaffected. The creature is immune to Fear The Flames for 24 hours.
Success The target is Frightened 1.
Failure The target Frightened 1 and Fascinated for 1 round.
Critical Failure As failure, the target is Frightened 2 and takes 2d4 persistent fire damage.

listCustomSpells.name: Inner Strength
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You tap into your inner strength, a reservoire of unmatched zeal and conviction.

You gain regeneration 10 which restores 10 Hit Points to you at the start of each of your turns. While you have regeneration, you can't die from damage and your dying condition can't increase to a value that would kill you (this stops most creatures from going beyond dying 3), though if your wounded value becomes 4 or higher, you stay unconscious until your wounds are treated.

If you takes acid, fire or unholy damage, your regeneration deactivates until after the end of your next turn.

Each turn when you receive healing from inner strength you can try to counteract one poison or disease you are suffering from. When first casting this spell you can immediately end one kind of persistent damage you are suffering from, or choose to end one of the following conditions: Dazzled Blinded Deafened Clumsy 1 Drained 1 Enfeebled 1 Stupefied 1

listCustomSpells.name: Inspired Rhetoric
listCustomSpells.traits: Auditory, Concentrate, Emotion, Inquisitor, Judgement, Linguisitc, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You launch an insightful rhetoric at all foes within range, distracting them.
All enemies within range have to make a Will saving throw.

If any of the targets does not understand the language you are speaking, or
you're not speaking a language, that target has a +4 circumstancebonus to the save.

Critical Failure The target is distracted and takes a –3 status penalty to Will saves. The target can end the effect early with a retort, this requires a reaction and has the concentrate trait.
Typically, the retort needs to use a linguistic Charisma-based skill action.
Additionally the target takes 2d4 persistent mental damage.


Failure As critical failure, but the penalty is –2, the target takes no persistent mental damage.

Inspired Rhetoric
Success The target is unaffected.

Heightened (+2) the persistent mental damage on a critical failure is increased by 2d4.

listCustomSpells.name: Judicious Force
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Trigger an ally has successfully hit a creature with a Strike, but has not yet rolled for damage.

You empower the weapon at the last moment. You grant it the power of a Deadly 1d8 rune for this Strike only. The triggering Strike also adds 2d12 force force damage.

Heightened (8th) The size of the deadly rune increases to a 1d10. The extra force damage is increased to 3d12 force.
Heightened (10th) The size of the deadly rune increases to a 1d12. The extra force damage is increased to 4d12 force

listCustomSpells.name: Luminous Flare
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Area 10-foot-burst
Saving Throw Reflex

You create a flare of radiant energy that leaves tiny specs of light in the area.

Each creature must attempt a Reflex save. If a creature has its invisibility negated by this spell, it is concealed instead of invisible. This applies both if the creature was already invisible and if it benefits from new invisibility effects before the end of the invisibility negation effect from this spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target's invisibility is negated for 2
rounds.
Failure The target is Dazzled for 1 minute and its invisibility is negated for 1 minute.
Critical Failure The target is Blinded for 1 round and Dazzled for 1 minute. Its invisibility is negated for 1 minutes.

listCustomSpells.name: Mend The Broken
listCustomSpells.traits: Healing, Vitality, Inquisitor, Judgement, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range touch
Targets 1 creature

You use positive energy to heal those who are broken.

You heal 4d4 vitality Hit Points to a target and it gains regeneration 5.

If you use this against an unwilling or undead creature, it has to make a Will saving throw, if it fails it is only affected by the initial healing, not the regeneration.

Heightened (+1) The initial healing increases by 1d4 vitality
and the regeneration increases by 2

listCustomSpells.name: Oblation
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You create a magical barrier that protects from harm.

The target gains resistance equal to double the spell's level to all damage, and gains a +2 status bonus to AC and all saves.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your barrier. The barrier has Hardness 25. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

listCustomSpells.name: Poison The Well
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 60 feet
Area 10 foot burst
Saving Throw Reflex

You throw an orb of concentrated magic towards your foe that will detonate with a foul concoction upon impact. The orb deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage to any creatures in the 10-foot burst at the center of its area with a basic Reflex save. The orb then detonates, dealing 1d4 poison damage and 1d4 acid damage to any creatures in its 20-foot burst with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure the target is Sickened 1

Heightened (+2) the bludgeoning damage increases by 1d6, the poison and acid damage increases by 1d4.
Heightened (7th) you throw two orb, but the central 10-foot bursts can't overlap, and a creature takes
the same amount of poison and acid damage no matter how many overlapping detonations it's caught in

listCustomSpells.name: Quintessence Possession
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 foot
Targets 1 creature
Duration 1 minute

You send your mind and soul into the target's body, attempting to take control. The target must attempt a Will save. While you're possessing a target, your own body is unconscious and can't wake up normally. You can sense everything the possessed target does.

You can Dismiss this spell.

If the possessed body dies, the spell ends. If the spell ends during an encounter, you act just before the possessed creature's initiative count.



Critical Success The target is Stunned 1.
Success The target is Stunned 2.
Failure You possess the target and take partial control of it. You no longer have a separate turn; instead, you might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's controlled by you on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; You are able to sustain your own spells while controlling the target and benefit from them.
Critical Failure You possess the target fully, it no longer makes a Will save each turn.


Special You can cast this spell as a if you drop down to 0 Hit Points. But only against the triggering creature.

listCustomSpells.name: Salted Earth
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Area 20 foot burst

You take drastic measures to take down your foes. You throw an orb of divine energy that deals 6d4 bludgeoning damage to any creatures in the 20-foot burst with a basic Reflex save before exploding.

Critical Success the creature is unaffected.
Success the creature takes half the bludgeoning damage but additional 4d4 fire damage.
Failure the creature takes additional 8d4 persistent fire fire damage.
Critical Failure As failure, but the persistent damage is doubled.

listCustomSpells.name: Spirits Within
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range touch
Targets 1 target

You attack your target with a blinding light. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 force damage and 1 persistent mental damage it also becomes Dazzled until the end of its next round. On a critical hit, It becomes Blinded instead.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d10 and the persistent damage by 1

listCustomSpells.name: Swaying Words
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 3 tagets
Duration 1 minute
Saving Throw Will

You can deliver a stirring speech trying to confuse the target.

The effects are determined by the target's Will save.

You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target ponders about what he heared and is Stunned 1.
Failure The target is Confused and Stupefied 2 for 1 turn, afterwards it is Confused for the duration of the spell. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns if it saw you take hostile action against it, or its companions.
Critical Failure As failure, with no save to end early.

Heightened (+1) increase the number of creatures you target by 1.

listCustomSpells.name: Veil of Ideals
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range self
Duration 1 minute

Your ideals serve as a shield, and a veil against would be attackers.

You gain 20 temporary Hit Points, while you have these Hit Points you shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for the next 20 feet, you also are concealed to all enemies that require sight to see you, as the light over takes their senses.

The spell fades after 1 minute or once your temporary Hit Points reach 0, Whichever comes first

Heightened (+1) The amount of temporary Hit Points by 5

listCustomSpells.name: Vexing Bolt
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Choose a target within your reach. You shoot a bolt of concentrated energy right at it. The Vexing Bolt automatically deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to the target.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d4+1

listCustomSpells.name: Word of Anathema
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature
Duration 1 minute
Saving Throw Will

You speak a word of anathema against a single creature, conveying everything your target despises or prohibits, audible only to them.

The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target takes 5d4 mental damage, is Frightened 1, and can't benefit from circumstance or status bonuses.
Failure The target takes 10d4 mental damage, is Frightened 2, and can't benefit from circumstance or status bonuses. While the curse remains, the target's allies are also unable to benefit from circumstance or status bonuses while within 10 feet of it.
Critical Failure As failure, but the damage is increased to 20d4, and the range of the aura to 30 feet.

Heightened (+1) increase the damage by 4d4.

listCustomSpells.name: Zealous Derision
listCustomSpells.traits: Auditory, Emotion, Inquisitor, Linguisitc, Mental, Judgement, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 60 feet
Targets 1 creature
Duration 1 minute
Saving Throw Will

You unleash a string of zealous gibberish or insults, laced with subtle enchantments at a creature, goading it to strike back at you. It takes a –1 status penalty to attack rolls against creatures other than you.
The creature must attempt a Will saving throw. If the target doesn't understand the language or you're not speaking a language, it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its save.



Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The spell ends at the end of the target's next turn.
Failure As Success, but for 1 minute.
Critical Failure As Failure, but the status penalty is –2 and the target is also Fascinated by you.

listCustomSpecial.name: Anchor of Life
listCustomSpecial.description: You create an anchor point to help with recovery and healing. You gain the  Anchor of Life spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Chains of Justice
listCustomSpecial.description:
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Conversion
listCustomSpecial.description:
Conversion
You are a powerful persuader. A honeyed tongue empowered by divine argumentation sways the indifferent and adversarial to your side.

You're more inclined to turn others to your side, than you are to
destroy them. But you don't shy away with causing
confusion or infighting before you do so.

Skill Training: You become trained in diplomacy.
Skill Feat: You gain the Group Impression skill feat.
Additional Spell: You add Befuddle to your spell repertoire
Minor Ideal Benefit:
You confuse your enemies with words you have
carefully chosen. You gain the Inspired Rhetoricfocus spell. A spell that weakens the will saves of those who's mind are brought to doubt by your words

Grand Ideal Benefit:
You can deliver a stirring speech condemning the mistakes of those in power while calling for reform or change.

You gain the Swaying words focus spell. A spell which has the possibility of confusing your enemies.

listCustomSpecial.name: Damnation
listCustomSpecial.description:
The prospect of an afterlife filled with torment can cause even the most stalwart to blanch, at least for a moment.

You're extravagant, and a skilled performer, you're more inclined to sow chaos and leave yourenemies in disarray, than you are to help or destroy
them.

Skill Training: You become trained in Performance.
Skill Feat: You gain the Impressive Performanceskill
feat.
Additional Spell: You add Lose the Path to your spell
repertoire.
Minor Ideal Benefits:
You frighten a creature you can see with an eternity of suffering. You gain the Fear The Flames focus spell. A spell that might even burn enemies as fear overtakes them.

Grand Ideal Benefits:

You instill the fear of a soul stealing monstrosity unto a living creature, making it think something is here to drag its soul away to oblivion and eternal damnation.

You gain the Collector of Souls focus spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Heresy
listCustomSpecial.description:
The prospect of an afterlife filled with torment can cause even the most stalwart to blanch, at least for a moment.

You're extravagant, and a skilled performer, you're more inclined to sow chaos and leave yourenemies in disarray, than you are to help or destroy
them.

Skill Training: You become trained in Performance.
Skill Feat: You gain the Impressive Performance skill feat.
Additional Spell: You add Lose the Path to your spell
repertoire.
Minor Ideal Benefits:
You frighten a creature you can see with an eternity of suffering. You gain the Poison The Well focus spell. A spell that might even burn enemies as fear overtakes them.

Grand Ideal Benefit

You cast a forbidden curse against a single creature, which conveys everything it despises, or its deity prohibits, affecting it dearly.

You gain the Word of Anathema focus spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ideals
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your ideal also adds a spell to your spell repertoire that normally is not available to the divine tradition, but for you counts as a divine spell.
If you are already trained in the skill given by your minor ideal benefit, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Likewise, if you already know the skill feat, you select another 1st level skill feat forwhich you meet the prerequisites

listCustomSpecial.name: Initial Inquisition
listCustomSpecial.description:
You set out on an inquisition to come closer to realising your ideal.
Choose an Initial Inquisition, you gain its associated focus spell.

Inquisitions are described below the Ideals section.
Additionally, you gain an additional skill increase, which you can use to become trained in a skill, or become expert in a skill you are already trained in.
You also gain a skill feat that you meet the prerequisites for.



ANCHOR OF LIFE
You create an anchor point to help with recovery and
healing. You gain the Anchor of Life spell.

CHAINS OF JUSTICE
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

SPIRITS WITHIN
You attack with a blinding light, potentially
blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus
spell.

VEIL OF IDEALS

You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain
concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Spirits Within
listCustomSpecial.description: You attack with a blinding light, potentially blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Stern Gaze
listCustomSpecial.description:
Inquisitors are skilled at intimidating their foes. You gain the Stern Gaze reaction, which allows you to to take a stern look at a foes and fill them with fear

Trigger You critically succeed with a Strike, or a foe within your reach critically fails a Strike against you.

If the foe was temporarily immune to your Demoralize, their temporary immunity ends, and you can immediately try to Demoralize the target again with a +1 circumstance bonus to Intimidation

listCustomSpecial.name: Veil of Ideals
listCustomSpecial.description:
You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain
concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Zeal [Acrobatics]
listCustomSpecial.description:
An inquisitor needs unyielding zeal in order to make sure its deity's work is done. You're so occupied with your own ideals, so convinded of how much they're worth, that you can't possibly fathom anyone who might oppose them. You're inclined to brag , and talk about them all the time, and care very little for those that oppose your ideals and values, as long as they don't become an immediate threat.

Skill Training You become trained in Athletics or Acrobatics.

Skill Feat You gain the Quick Jump skill feat if you chose Athletics, you gain the Cat Fall skill feat if you chose Acrobatics.
Additional Spell You add Sure Strike to your spell repertoire.

Minor Ideal Benefits: Zeal You unleash a string of zealous propaganda, laced with subtle enchantments, at a creature you can see.

Stirring it to attack you, and only you. You gain the Zealous Derision focus spell.
A focus spell that goads your enemies to attack you, or take a penalty to their attack rolls.

Grand Ideal Benefit

You tap into your inner strength, a reservoire of unmatched zeal and conviction.

You gain the Inner Strength focus spell, which allows you to overcome certain conditions and gives you a new lease on life.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1

listCustomSpecial.name: Zeal [Athletics]
listCustomSpecial.description:
An inquisitor needs unyielding zeal in order to make sure its deity's work is done. You're so occupied with your own ideals, so convinded of how much tey're worth, that you can't possibly fathom anyone who might oppose them. You're inclined to brag , and talk about them all the time, and care very little for those that oppose your ideals and values, as long as they don't become an immediate threat.

Skill Training You become trained in Athletics or Acrobatics.

Skill Feat You gain the Quick Jump skill feat if you chose Atheltics, you gain the Cat Fall skill feat if you chose Acrobatics.
Additional Spell You add Sure Strike to your spell repertoire.

Minor Ideal Benefits: Zeal You tap into your inner strength, a reservoire of unmatched zeal and conviction.

You gain the Inner Strength focus spell, which allows you to overcome certain conditions and gives you a new lease on life.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1

listCustomClasses.name: Inquisitor

listCustomSpecials.name: Divine Spellcasting (Inquisitor)
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your Deity and ideal provides you with divine magical power. You can cast spells using the Cast a Spell activity, and you can supply material, somatic, and verbal components when casting spells. Because you're an inquisitor, you can draw replacement sigils with the tip of your weapon or your free hand for spells requiring material components, replacing them with somatic components instead of needing a material component pouch.


At 1st level, you can cast up to two 1st-level spells per day. You must know spells to cast them, and you learn them via the spell repertoire class feature. The number of spells you can cast each day is called your spell slots. As you increase in level as an inquisitor, your number of spells per day increases, as does the highest level of spells you can cast, as shown on Table 1–2: Inquisitor Spells per Day. Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack roll to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC, wisdom is your modifier for this.

listCustomSpecials.name: Judgement Spells
listCustomSpecials.description:
You learn the baleful bane judgement spell and you can cast additional judgement spells by selecting certain feats. Judgement spells are inquisitor-specific spells created for combat and are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to both study your spellbook and perform a physical regimen.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up. Focus spells don’t require spell slots, nor can you cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 points. The full rules can be found on page 300 of the Core Rulebook.

listCustomSpecials.name: Deity
listCustomSpecials.description:
As an Inquisitor, you are a mortal servitor of a deity you revere above all others. Your deity grants you the trained proficiency rank in one skill and with the deity's favored weapon. If the favored weapon is uncommon, you also get access to that weapon.

Your deity also adds spells to your spell list. You can prepare these just like you can any spell on the divine spell list once you can prepare spells of their rank as a inquisitor. Any of these spells that aren't normally on the divine list are still divine spells if you prepare them this way.

listCustomSpecials.name: Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description:
Inquisitors are privy to special lore not open to priests and other agents of their religion. These divine pursuits, called ideals, grant inquisitors the tools necessary for the fight against enemies of the faith.


At 1st level, your ideal grants you a free trained skill, a skill feat to go with it, and an additional spell for your spell repertoire. You also gain the minor ideal benefits, which at first level includes a new focus spell for you to use against your enemies, or on your allies.

As an inquisitor, you select an ideal at 1st level. This ideal describes what you strive for how you view those in opposition of your deity and your values.
An ideal grants you you a minor ideal benefit at level 1, a skill feat and makes you trained in a the mentioned skill.

Your ideal also adds a spell to your spell repertoire that normally is not available to the divine tradition, but for you counts as a divine spell.
If you are already trained in the skill given by your minor ideal benefit, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. Likewise, if you already know the skill feat, you select another 1st level skill feat for which you meet the prerequisites

listCustomSpecials.name: Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description:
Inquisitors are privy to special lore not open to priests and other agents of their religion. These divine pursuits, called ideals, grant inquisitors the tools necessary for the fight against enemies of the faith.


At 1st level, your ideal grants you a free trained skill, a skill feat to go with it, and an additional spell for your spell repertoire. You also gain the minor ideal benefits, which at first level includes a new focus spell for you to use against your enemies, or on your allies.

As an inquisitor, you select an ideal at 1st level. This ideal describes what you strive for how you view those in opposition of your deity and your values.
An ideal grants you you a minor ideal benefit at level 1, a skill feat and makes you trained in a the mentioned skill.

Your ideal also adds a spell to your spell repertoire that normally is not available to the divine tradition, but for you counts as a divine spell.
If you are already trained in the skill given by your minor ideal benefit, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. Likewise, if you already know the skill feat, you select another 1st level skill feat for which you meet the prerequisites

listCustomSpecials.name: Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your ideal also adds a spell to your spell repertoire that normally is not available to the divine tradition, but for you counts as a divine spell.
If you are already trained in the skill given by your minor ideal benefit, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. Likewise, if you already know the skill feat, you select another 1st level skill feat for which you meet the prerequisites

listCustomSpecials.name: Alertness
listCustomSpecials.description:
Experience has made you increasingly aware of threats around you, and you react more quickly to danger.
Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Ideal Choice
listCustomSpecials.description: Choose your Ideal

listCustomSpecials.name: Stern Gaze
listCustomSpecials.description:
Inquisitors are skilled at intimidating their foes. You gain the Stern Gaze reaction.

Trigger You critically succeed with a Strike, or a foe within your reach critically fails a Strike against you.

If the foe was temporarily immune to your Demoralize, their temporary immunity ends, and you can immediately try to Demoralize the target again with a +1 circumstance bonus to Intimidation

The circumstance bonus increases to +2 at 11th level

Effect: Stern Gaze

listCustomSpecials.name: Unlimited Signature Spells
listCustomSpecials.description: All of your spells are signature spells. That means that if you know a spell, you can heighten it freely by casting it from a higher-rank spell slot, up to the maximum rank of spell you can cast. You can similarly cast any of its lower-rank versions without learning them separately.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons in the bow and firearm categories, unarmed attacks and your deity' favorite weapon increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Initial Inquisitons
listCustomSpecials.description:
You set out on an inquisition to come closer to realising your ideal.
Choose an Initial Inquisition, you gain its associated focus spell.

Inquisitions are described below the Ideals section.
Additionally, you gain an additional skill increase, which you can use to become trained in a skill, or become expert in a skill you are already trained in.
You also gain a skill feat that you meet the prerequisites for.



ANCHOR OF LIFE
You create an anchor point to help with recovery and
healing. You gain the Anchor of Life spell.

CHAINS OF JUSTICE
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

SPIRITS WITHIN
You attack with a blinding light, potentionally
blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus
spell.

VEIL OF IDEALS

You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain
concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecials.description:
You create an anchor point to help with recovery and
healing. You gain the Anchor of Life focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Chains of Justice
listCustomSpecials.description:
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spirits Within
listCustomSpecials.description:
You attack with a blinding light, potentially
blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus
spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Veil of Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description:
You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain
concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fortitude Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency
rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Resolve
listCustomSpecials.description: You've steeled your mind with resolve. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to defend yourself better against attacks. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Divine Smite
listCustomSpecials.description:
As you grow closer to realizing you ideal, you become more refined in your use of divine energy and judgement spells.


You no longer need to critically hit with a Strike, or get a critical failure on save, to gain the additional effect on spells with the judgement trait (like the persistent damage on Baleful Bane).


A regular success for Strikes, or a regular failure for saves, is enough to engulf your target in energy damage.

Additionally, your eyes pierce right into your target's mind. The circumstance bonus from Stern Gaze increases to +2.

listCustomSpecials.name: Advanced Inquisition
listCustomSpecials.description:
You come closer to realizing your Ideal. Choose an advanced inquisition or initial inquisition, you gain its associated focus spell.


Additionally, you gain an additional skill increase, which you can use to become trained in a skill, or become expert in a skill you are already trained, or become master in a skill you are already expert in.

You also receive a skill feat that you meet the prerequisites for.

listCustomSpecials.name: Crest of Faith
listCustomSpecials.description: A create a shield around yourself that will heal you when broken. You gain the Crest of Faith focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Divine Prison
listCustomSpecials.description:
You cage your target with the help of divine light,
binding it. You gain the Divine Prison focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Judicious Force
listCustomSpecials.description:
You strengthen the blows of you or your allies. You
gain the Judicious Force focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Salted Earth
listCustomSpecials.description:
You take drastic measures and salt the earth around
you. You gain the Salted Earth focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Anchor of Life
listCustomSpecials.description:
You create an anchor point to help with recovery and
healing. You gain the Anchor of Life spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Chains of Justice
listCustomSpecials.description:
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spirits Within
listCustomSpecials.description:
You attack with a blinding light, potentially
blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus
spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Veil of Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description:
You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain
concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Inquisitor Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description:
You fully understand your weapons.

Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons in the bow and firearm categories, unarmed attacks and your deity' favorite weapon increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Stalwart
listCustomSpecials.description:
If you've picked Strength as your key ability score, your proficiency rank for Fortitude increases to master.

If you've picked Dexterity as your key ability score, your proficiency rank for Reflex increases to master.

When you roll a success on the saving throw that you increased with this class feature, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Stalwart [Strength]
listCustomSpecials.description: If you've picked Strength as your key ability score, your proficiency rank for Fortitude increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Stalwart [Dexterity]
listCustomSpecials.description: If you've picked Dexterity as your key ability score, your proficiency rank for Reflex increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Expert Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've learned to better control the power your deity
has granted you. Your proficiency ranks for divine
spell attack rolls and spell DCs increase to expert

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: You fortify your spells with masterful prowess. Your proficiency ranks for divine spell attack rolls and spell DCs increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: True Inquisition
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your Ideal is within reach. Choose a true inquisition, advanced inquisition, or initial inquisition, you gain its associated focus spell.


Additionally, Additionally, you gain a skill increase, which you can use to become trained in a skill, become expert in a skill you are already trained in, or become master in a skill you are already expert in. You can not use both skill increases to increase the same skill.

You also gain a skill feat for which you meet the prerequisites.

listCustomSpecials.name: Banner of the profane Oath
listCustomSpecials.description:
You place down a magical banner granting strength.
You gain the banner of the Banner of the profane Oath focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Excommunicate
listCustomSpecials.description:
You curse a target to make it feel alone and abandoned.
You gain the Excommunicate focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Oblation
listCustomSpecials.description:
You create a magical barrier that protects from harm.

The target gains resistance equal to double the spell's level to all damage, and gains a +2 status bonus to AC and all saves.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your barrier. The barrier has Hardness 25. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Quintessence Possession
listCustomSpecials.description:
You try to take over another creature.
You gain the Quintessence Possession focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Crest of Faith
listCustomSpecials.description: A create a shield around yourself that will heal you when broken. You gain the Crest of Faith focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Divine Prison
listCustomSpecials.description:
You cage your target with the help of divine light,
binding it. You gain the Divine Prison focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Judicious Force
listCustomSpecials.description: You strengthen the blows of you or your allies. You gain the Judicious Force focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Salted Earth
listCustomSpecials.description:
You take drastic measures and salt the earth around
you. You gain the Salted Earth focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Anchor of Life
listCustomSpecials.description:
You create an anchor point to help with recovery and
healing. You gain the Anchor of Life spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Chains of Justice
listCustomSpecials.description:
You bind your target with spectral chains, forcing it to
share your damage. You gain the Chains of Justice focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spirits Within
listCustomSpecials.description: You attack with a blinding light, potentially blinding your target. You gain the Spirits Within focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Veil of Ideals
listCustomSpecials.description: You use your Ideals to protect yourself and gain concealment. You gain the Veil of Ideals focus spell

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with light and medium armor improves, increasing your ability to avoid blows. Your proficiency ranks for light and medium armor, as well as for unarmed defense, increase to master.

listCustomClasses.description:
Grim and determined, the inquisitor roots out enemies of the faith, using trickery and
guile when righteousness and purity is not enough. Although inquisitors are dedicated
to a deity, they are above many of the normal rules and conventions of the church.
They answer to their deity and their own sense of justice alone, and are willing to take
extreme measures to meet their goals.
